page.title: 16Inside the Museum grounds.
page.content: There are some more things which interest me, like the people who put cockerals in the cock-pits. Inside the cock-pit there was a circle, in which people put cocks to fight to death. A swallow had nested in the roof of the cockpit and was making quite a noise. The two classes also went to the tannery, the coopery, and just before they were leaving, they saw a place which showed different kinds of vehicles, that were used in the olden days, such as the Ox-lain cart, the gipsy caravan and other vehicles. I'm glad I'm a pupil in Class 3.
